CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: A highly effective photovoltaic polymer with near - infrared response , poly{N- [3,4-c]pyrrole-1,4-dione-5 0 ,5 00 -diyl } {PDTP-DTDPP(Bu)} , was synthesized. The polymer has high molecular weight , good solubility , and a broad absorption spectrum in the range of 500-1100 nm. Field effect transistor charge mobility of PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) arrived 0.05 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 . Bulk heterojunction type polymer solar cells based on PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) and PC 70 BM have broad photocurrent response wavelength range from 300 nm to 1.1 μm. High short - circuit current ( 14.87 mA / cm^2 ) and power conversion efficiency ( 2.71% ) were achieved , which is a significant advance for efficient photovoltaic polymers that respond to the whole range of the solar spectrum . In the past decade , polymer solar cells ( PSCs ) have received a great deal of attention as a potential renewable energy source due to their potential advantages such as low fabrication cost , light weight , and fast production of large area devices by roll - to - roll solution processes. 1 Among photovoltaic polymers , regioregular poly(3-hexylthiophene) ( P3HT ) has been extensively studied. Bulk heterojunction ( BHJ ) photovoltaic device combining P3HT as the electron donor with [6,6]-phenyl C 61 butyric acid methyl ester ( PCBM ) as the electron acceptor have achieved power conversion efficiencies ( PCEs ) as high as 4-5 % . 2 However , the upper limit seems to have been reached for this material combination , as P3HT utilizes only photons located in the highenergy fraction of the solar spectrum with wavelengths below 650 nm. In fact , ∼ 40% of the total solar energy lies in the range of 650-1100 nm , which is a strong driving force for developing lowbandgap polymers to utilize the solar energy in the near - infrared ( NIR ) range. 3 Recently , significant progress has been made in the photovoltaic application of novel low - bandgap polymers with optical absorption wavelengths in the range of 700-900 nm. 4 Nevertheless , design of efficient photovoltaic polymers with optical absorption and photocurrent response extending to wavelengths of micrometers remains challenging. The first example of this kind of micrometer - response polymer ( μmR - polymer ) was APFO - Green1 , reported by Ingan € as et al. in 2004.^5 Subsequently , considerable effort has been devoted to the design and synthesize of μmR - polymers via a synthetic strategy of combining electronrich units ( donors ) and electron - deficient units ( acceptors ) in a copolymer main chain. To date , no more than 10 μmR - polymers have been synthesized , which are primarily based on a very strong electron - deficient unit such as [1,2,5]thiadiazolo [3,4-g]quinoxaline , 6 thienopyrazine , 7 or thieno [3,4-c][1,2,5]thiadiazole.

Let's think step by step.

The "Material Name" entities in the paragraph can be identified as follows:

1. poly{N-[3,4-c]pyrrole-1,4-dione-5,50-diyl} {PDTP-DTDPP(Bu)}
2. PDTP-DTDPP(Bu)
3. PC 70 BM
4. P3HT (regioregular poly(3-hexylthiophene))
5. PCBM ( [6,6]-phenyl C61 butyric acid methyl ester)
6. APFO-Green1
7. [1,2,5]thiadiazolo[3,4-g]quinoxaline
8. thienopyrazine
9. thieno[3,4-c][1,2,5]thiadiazole

These are the names of the materials mentioned in the paragraph, which are all photovoltaic polymers or related compounds.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

Sure, here are the entities that clearly refer to Material Name in the given paragraph:

1. poly{N-[3,4-c]pyrrole-1,4-dione-5,50-diyl} {PDTP-DTDPP(Bu)}
2. PDTP-DTDPP(Bu)
3. P3HT (regioregular poly(3-hexylthiophene))
4. PCBM ( [6,6]-phenyl C61 butyric acid methyl ester)
5. APFO-Green1

These are the material names mentioned in the paragraph.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Sure, here's a Markdown table with the valid entities in the "Material Name" column:

| Material Name |
| --- |
| poly{N-[3,4-c]pyrrole-1,4-dione-5,50-diyl} {PDTP-DTDPP(Bu)} |
| PDTP-DTDPP(Bu) |
| P3HT (regioregular poly(3-hexylthiophene)) |
| PCBM ( [6,6]-phenyl C61 butyric acid methyl ester) |
| APFO-Green1 |

PN.content:
Please identify the Property Names of materials in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: A highly effective photovoltaic polymer with near - infrared response , poly{N- [3,4-c]pyrrole-1,4-dione-5 0 ,5 00 -diyl } {PDTP-DTDPP(Bu)} , was synthesized. The polymer has high molecular weight , good solubility , and a broad absorption spectrum in the range of 500-1100 nm. Field effect transistor charge mobility of PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) arrived 0.05 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 . Bulk heterojunction type polymer solar cells based on PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) and PC 70 BM have broad photocurrent response wavelength range from 300 nm to 1.1 μm. High short - circuit current ( 14.87 mA / cm^2 ) and power conversion efficiency ( 2.71% ) were achieved , which is a significant advance for efficient photovoltaic polymers that respond to the whole range of the solar spectrum . In the past decade , polymer solar cells ( PSCs ) have received a great deal of attention as a potential renewable energy source due to their potential advantages such as low fabrication cost , light weight , and fast production of large area devices by roll - to - roll solution processes. 1 Among photovoltaic polymers , regioregular poly(3-hexylthiophene) ( P3HT ) has been extensively studied. Bulk heterojunction ( BHJ ) photovoltaic device combining P3HT as the electron donor with [6,6]-phenyl C 61 butyric acid methyl ester ( PCBM ) as the electron acceptor have achieved power conversion efficiencies ( PCEs ) as high as 4-5 % . 2 However , the upper limit seems to have been reached for this material combination , as P3HT utilizes only photons located in the highenergy fraction of the solar spectrum with wavelengths below 650 nm. In fact , ∼ 40% of the total solar energy lies in the range of 650-1100 nm , which is a strong driving force for developing lowbandgap polymers to utilize the solar energy in the near - infrared ( NIR ) range. 3 Recently , significant progress has been made in the photovoltaic application of novel low - bandgap polymers with optical absorption wavelengths in the range of 700-900 nm. 4 Nevertheless , design of efficient photovoltaic polymers with optical absorption and photocurrent response extending to wavelengths of micrometers remains challenging. The first example of this kind of micrometer - response polymer ( μmR - polymer ) was APFO - Green1 , reported by Ingan € as et al. in 2004.^5 Subsequently , considerable effort has been devoted to the design and synthesize of μmR - polymers via a synthetic strategy of combining electronrich units ( donors ) and electron - deficient units ( acceptors ) in a copolymer main chain. To date , no more than 10 μmR - polymers have been synthesized , which are primarily based on a very strong electron - deficient unit such as [1,2,5]thiadiazolo [3,4-g]quinoxaline , 6 thienopyrazine , 7 or thieno [3,4-c][1,2,5]thiadiazole.

Let's think step by step.

Okay! Here are the property names of materials mentioned in the paragraph:

1. Poly{N-[3,4-c]pyrrole-1,4-dione-5,5'-diyl} {PDTP-DTDPP(Bu)} - High effective photovoltaic polymer with near-infrared response
2. PC 70 BM - Polymer used in bulk heterojunction type polymer solar cells
3. Regioregular poly(3-hexylthiophene) (P3HT) - Photovoltaic polymer extensively studied in the past decade
4. [6,6]-phenyl C61 butyric acid methyl ester (PCBM) - Electron acceptor used in bulk heterojunction photovoltaic devices
5. APFO-Green1 - First example of micrometer-response polymer (μmR-polymer)
6. [1,2,5]thiadiazolo[3,4-g]quinoxaline - Strong electron-deficient unit used in the synthesis of μmR-polymers
7. Thienopyrazine - Electron-deficient unit used in the synthesis of μmR-polymers
8. Thieno[3,4-c][1,2,5]thiadiazole - Electron-deficient unit used in the synthesis of μmR-polymers

Please let me know if you need any further assistance!

Sure, here are the entities that refer to Property Name of Material:

3. PCBM - [6,6]-phenyl C61 butyric acid methyl ester
4. APFO-Green1 - Micrometer-response polymer (μmR-polymer)
5. [1,2,5]thiadiazolo[3,4-g]quinoxaline - Electron-deficient unit used in the synthesis of μmR-polymers
6. Thienopyrazine - Electron-deficient unit used in the synthesis of μmR-polymers
7. Thieno[3,4-c][1,2,5]thiadiazole - Electron-deficient unit used in the synthesis of μmR-polymers

2. PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) (not a property name)
3. μmR-polymer (not a property name)

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Sure, here are the valid entities presented as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name":

| PCBM |

PV.content:
Please identify the Values (number + unit) of material properties in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: A highly effective photovoltaic polymer with near - infrared response , poly{N- [3,4-c]pyrrole-1,4-dione-5 0 ,5 00 -diyl } {PDTP-DTDPP(Bu)} , was synthesized. The polymer has high molecular weight , good solubility , and a broad absorption spectrum in the range of 500-1100 nm. Field effect transistor charge mobility of PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) arrived 0.05 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 . Bulk heterojunction type polymer solar cells based on PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) and PC 70 BM have broad photocurrent response wavelength range from 300 nm to 1.1 μm. High short - circuit current ( 14.87 mA / cm^2 ) and power conversion efficiency ( 2.71% ) were achieved , which is a significant advance for efficient photovoltaic polymers that respond to the whole range of the solar spectrum . In the past decade , polymer solar cells ( PSCs ) have received a great deal of attention as a potential renewable energy source due to their potential advantages such as low fabrication cost , light weight , and fast production of large area devices by roll - to - roll solution processes. 1 Among photovoltaic polymers , regioregular poly(3-hexylthiophene) ( P3HT ) has been extensively studied. Bulk heterojunction ( BHJ ) photovoltaic device combining P3HT as the electron donor with [6,6]-phenyl C 61 butyric acid methyl ester ( PCBM ) as the electron acceptor have achieved power conversion efficiencies ( PCEs ) as high as 4-5 % . 2 However , the upper limit seems to have been reached for this material combination , as P3HT utilizes only photons located in the highenergy fraction of the solar spectrum with wavelengths below 650 nm. In fact , ∼ 40% of the total solar energy lies in the range of 650-1100 nm , which is a strong driving force for developing lowbandgap polymers to utilize the solar energy in the near - infrared ( NIR ) range. 3 Recently , significant progress has been made in the photovoltaic application of novel low - bandgap polymers with optical absorption wavelengths in the range of 700-900 nm. 4 Nevertheless , design of efficient photovoltaic polymers with optical absorption and photocurrent response extending to wavelengths of micrometers remains challenging. The first example of this kind of micrometer - response polymer ( μmR - polymer ) was APFO - Green1 , reported by Ingan € as et al. in 2004.^5 Subsequently , considerable effort has been devoted to the design and synthesize of μmR - polymers via a synthetic strategy of combining electronrich units ( donors ) and electron - deficient units ( acceptors ) in a copolymer main chain. To date , no more than 10 μmR - polymers have been synthesized , which are primarily based on a very strong electron - deficient unit such as [1,2,5]thiadiazolo [3,4-g]quinoxaline , 6 thienopyrazine , 7 or thieno [3,4-c][1,2,5]thiadiazole.

Let's think step by step.

1. First, let's identify the values (number + unit) of material properties in the paragraph:

* Molecular weight of PDTP-DTDPP(Bu): high
* Solubility of PDTP-DTDPP(Bu): good
* Absorption spectrum range of PDTP-DTDPP(Bu): 500-1100 nm
* Field effect transistor charge mobility of PDTP-DTDPP(Bu): 0.05 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1
* Photocurrent response wavelength range of PDTP-DTDPP(Bu) and PC70BM: 300 nm to 1.1 μm
* Short-circuit current of PDTP-DTDPP(Bu) and PC70BM: 14.87 mA/cm^2
* Power conversion efficiency of PDTP-DTDPP(Bu) and PC70BM: 2.71%
* Power conversion efficiencies of P3HT and PCBM: up to 4-5%
* Upper limit of P3HT: wavelengths below 650 nm
* Total solar energy in the range of 650-1100 nm: ∼ 40%
* Optical absorption wavelengths of novel low-bandgap polymers: 700-900 nm
* Photocurrent response extending to wavelengths of micrometers: challenging
* First example of micrometer-response polymer (μmR-polymer): APFO-Green1
* Synthetic strategy for μmR-polymers: combining electron-rich units (donors) and electron-deficient units (acceptors) in a copolymer main chain
* Number of μmR-polymers synthesized to date: no more than 10
* Strong electron-deficient units in μmR-polymers: [1,2,5]thiadiazolo[3,4-g]quinoxaline, thienopyrazine, thieno[3,4-c][1,2,5]thiadiazole.

Now, let's organize the values in a table for better comparison:

| Material Property | Value |
| --- | --- |
| Molecular weight of PDTP-DTDPP(Bu) | high |
| Solubility of PDTP-DTDPP(Bu) | good |
| Absorption spectrum range of PDTP-DTDPP(Bu) | 500-1100 nm |
| Field effect transistor charge mobility of PDTP-DTDPP(Bu) | 0.05 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1 |
| Photocurrent response wavelength range of PDTP-DTDPP(Bu) and PC70BM | 300 nm to 1.1 μm |
| Short-circuit current of PDTP-DTDPP(Bu) and PC70BM | 14.87 mA/cm^2 |
| Power conversion efficiency of PDTP-DTDPP(Bu) and PC70BM | 2.71% |
| Power conversion efficiencies of P3HT and PCBM | up to 4-5% |
| Upper limit of P3HT | wavelengths below 650 nm |
| Total solar energy in the range of 650-1100 nm | ∼ 40% |
| Optical absorption wavelengths of novel low-bandgap polymers | 700-900 nm |
| Photocurrent response extending to wavelengths of micrometers | challenging |
| First example of micrometer-response polymer (μmR-polymer) | APFO-Green1 |
| Synthetic strategy for μmR-polymers | combining electron-rich units (donors) and electron-deficient units (acceptors) in a copolymer main chain |
| Number of μmR-polymers synthesized to date | no more than 10 |
| Strong electron-deficient units in μmR-polymers | [1,2,5]thiadiazolo[3,4-g]quinoxaline, thienopyrazine, thieno[3,4-c][1,2,5]thiadiazole |

Now, it's easier to compare and analyze the values. For example, we can see that the absorption spectrum range of PDTP-DTDPP(Bu) is much broader than that of P3HT, and its short-circuit current is also higher. Additionally, the power conversion efficiency of PDTP-DTDPP(Bu) and PC70BM is higher than that of P3HT and PCBM. However, the upper limit of P3HT is still a challenge for efficient photovoltaic polymers.
